  "title": "Corporate Marketing & Lead Conversion Executive",
  "description": "Nigeriamarkt is an ultimate online market place where buyers and sellers connect effortlessly! Whether you&rsquo;re looking to sell pre-loved items, discover amazing deals, or find essential services, we make it simple, secure, and convenient. Our platform is designed to empower individuals and businesses by providing a seamless and user-friendly experience. With just a few clicks, you can list your items, connect with potential buyers, and close deals&mdash;all without the hassle of middlemen or extra fees.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Corporate Marketing &amp; Lead Conversion Executive
Job Location:&nbsp;Benin City, Edo
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Overview


	We are seeking results-driven Corporate Marketing &amp; Lead Conversion Executives to drive business growth for Nigeria Markt.
	This role focuses on offline marketing, relationship-building, and converting business leads into active sellers and service providers on the platform.
	You will be the bridge between Nigeria Markt and the business community &mdash; building trust, explaining our value, and turning conversations into sign-ups.


Key Responsibilities
Primary Support:&nbsp;
Offline Marketing:


	Actively engage vendors, business owners, and service providers through in-person visits and meetings.
	Represent Nigeria Markt at markets, business hubs, trade areas, and networking events.
	Promote the platform&rsquo;s benefits and opportunities for increased visibility and sales.


Lead Follow-up:


	Follow up consistently with prospects through calls, messages, and in-person meetings.
	Communicate clearly how Nigeria Markt works and guide prospects toward registration.
	Address objections and provide practical solutions that encourage sign-up.


Community Engagement:


	Build strong relationships with local business communities and associations.
	Develop partnerships that increase awareness and trust in Nigeria Markt.
	Serve as a familiar and reliable contact between the company and vendors.


Secondary Support:
Customer Onboarding:


	Support the onboarding team during high-volume periods.
	Assist new vendors with basic steps such as account setup and listing guidance.


Feedback Integration:;


	Gather feedback from vendors and prospects in the field.
	Share insights with the marketing and product teams to help improve campaigns and platform experience.


Performance &amp; Reporting:


	Maintain a structured pipeline of leads and follow-ups.
	Meet weekly and monthly outreach and conversion targets.
	Provide regular reports on field activities, partnerships, and successful sign-ups.


Requirements


	Experience in sales, field marketing, business development, or lead generation.
	Strong interpersonal and persuasion skills.
	Confidence engaging business owners and decision-makers face-to-face.
	Self-motivated, target-driven, and comfortable working in the field.
	Good follow-up, record-keeping, and communication skills.
	Must be based in Benin City and available to work onsite and in the field.


Nice to Have:


	Experience in B2B or marketplace-related sales
	Existing connections within local business communities
	Familiarity with digital platforms or onboarding processes


What We Offer


	Opportunity to play a key role in expanding a growing digital marketplace.
	Performance-based incentives and bonuses.
	Career growth opportunities as Nigeria Markt scales.
	A supportive and energetic team environment.


Method of Application&nbsp;

Corporate Marketing & Lead Conversion Executive Job at Nigeriamarkt




        
    

        
        Nigeriamarkt is an ultimate online market place where buyers and sellers connect effortlessly! Whether you’re looking to sell pre-loved items, discover amazing deals, or find essential services, we make it simple, secure, and convenient. Our platform is designed to empower individuals and businesses by providing a seamless and user-friendly experience. With just a few clicks, you can list your items, connect with potential buyers, and close deals—all without the hassle of middlemen or extra fees.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Corporate Marketing & Lead Conversion Executive
Job Location: Benin City, Edo
Employment Type: Full-time
     

            
    



Role Overview


	We are seeking results-driven Corporate Marketing & Lead Conversion Executives to drive business growth for Nigeria Markt.
	This role focuses on offline marketing, relationship-building, and converting business leads into active sellers and service providers on the platform.
	You will be the bridge between Nigeria Markt and the business community — building trust, explaining our value, and turning conversations into sign-ups.


Key Responsibilities
Primary Support: 
Offline Marketing:


	Actively engage vendors, business owners, and service providers through in-person visits and meetings.
	Represent Nigeria Markt at markets, business hubs, trade areas, and networking events.
	Promote the platform’s benefits and opportunities for increased visibility and sales.


Lead Follow-up:


	Follow up consistently with prospects through calls, messages, and in-person meetings.
	Communicate clearly how Nigeria Markt works and guide prospects toward registration.
	Address objections and provide practical solutions that encourage sign-up.


Community Engagement:


	Build strong relationships with local business communities and associations.
	Develop partnerships that increase awareness and trust in Nigeria Markt.
	Serve as a familiar and reliable contact between the company and vendors.


Secondary Support:
Customer Onboarding:


	Support the onboarding team during high-volume periods.
	Assist new vendors with basic steps such as account setup and listing guidance.


Feedback Integration:;


	Gather feedback from vendors and prospects in the field.
	Share insights with the marketing and product teams to help improve campaigns and platform experience.


Performance & Reporting:


	Maintain a structured pipeline of leads and follow-ups.
	Meet weekly and monthly outreach and conversion targets.
	Provide regular reports on field activities, partnerships, and successful sign-ups.


Requirements


	Experience in sales, field marketing, business development, or lead generation.
	Strong interpersonal and persuasion skills.
	Confidence engaging business owners and decision-makers face-to-face.
	Self-motivated, target-driven, and comfortable working in the field.
	Good follow-up, record-keeping, and communication skills.
	Must be based in Benin City and available to work onsite and in the field.


Nice to Have:


	Experience in B2B or marketplace-related sales
	Existing connections within local business communities
	Familiarity with digital platforms or onboarding processes


What We Offer


	Opportunity to play a key role in expanding a growing digital marketplace.
	Performance-based incentives and bonuses.
	Career growth opportunities as Nigeria Markt scales.
	A supportive and energetic team environment.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a brief cover letter (highlighting their experience in sales, field marketing, or business development and why they would be a great fit for Nigeria Markt) to: nigeriamarkt@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Van Sales Representative Job at Estakem Ventures




        
    

        
        Estakem is a leading peanut,cookies and FMCG company.We are dedicated to delivering high-quality, delicious snacks to our customers. Our products are known for their exceptional taste, premium ingredients, and commitment to quality.Some of our products include Kings Delight peanuts,cookies and chin-chin.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Van Sales Representative 

Job Locations: Ikorodu and Lagos Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

            
    




	The Van Sales Representative (VSR) is responsible for selling and distributing Estakem peanut snacks across assigned routes and neighborhoods.
	The role involves driving sales vans, engaging customers, and ensuring accurate sales accounting and product accountability.
	The ideal candidate must be persuasive, reliable, and have a good knowledge of local routes and retail points.


Key Responsibilities


	Drive through assigned routes to sell and distribute Estakem products to customers and retail outlets.
	Build and maintain strong relationships with retailers and ensure product availability.
	Convince and upsell customers to increase sales volume.
	Accurately record all sales and collections, ensuring proper stock accountability.
	Submit daily sales and route reports to the Sales Supervisor.
	Monitor and report customer feedback and competitor activities.
	Ensure proper handling, loading, and display of products in retail outlets.
	Maintain the sales van in good working and clean condition, adhering to all road safety rules.


Requirements


	Must know neighborhood routes and local sales areas.
	1–2 years of experience in van or field sales (FMCG/snack experience preferred).
	Proven ability to sell and convince customers effectively.
	Ability to drive both manual and automatic vehicles.
	Must have a valid driver’s license.
	Basic record-keeping and arithmetic skills.
	Reliable, honest, and self-motivated with strong accountability.
	Good communication and customer service skills.


Added Advantage:


	Previous experience selling snacks or FMCG products.
	Familiarity with route sales reporting or mobile sales systems.


Salary
N90,000 - N100,000 per month. 

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV / Resume in PDF to: estakemhr@gmail.com using "Van Sales Representative" as the subject of the email.

  "title": "Social Media Associate",
  "description": "Korapay is a payment infrastructure servicing a wide band of businesses making local and international payments. We are a marketplace for digital financial services across Africa. Our vision, which is at the core of what we do every day, is to create a world void of digital financial barriers across Africa. We are committed to delivering reliable, secure, and easy to use digital financial solutions to every single customer with a guarantee that it is improving their lives.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media Associate

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Job type:&nbsp;Full-time (Hybrid)
Department: Marketing
Reporting Structure: This role reports to the&nbsp;Lead, Compliance

About the Role


	The Social Media Associate manages Kora&rsquo;s social presence end to end &mdash; from strategy to execution.
	You will use social platforms to educate businesses, drive demand for Kora&rsquo;s products and strengthen the brand across Africa and global markets.
	You will collaborate with Brand &amp; Product Marketing, Communications, Merchant Success, Design and Performance Marketing to ensure content is consistent, accurate and effective.
	Your work increases visibility, product understanding and inbound demand.


Key Responsibilities
Social Strategy and Execution:


	Manage social media channels end to end including strategy, planning, content creation and publishing.
	Develop platform-specific plans for LinkedIn, X, Instagram and YouTube.
	Maintain a consistent posting rhythm across all platforms.
	Ensure all content aligns with Kora&rsquo;s brand identity and messaging.


Product Education and Adoption:


	Turn product updates and feature information received from the Communications Associate into clear social content.
	Create simple explanations for API capabilities, payment flows and new features.
	Produce educational content that drives interest, trust and product adoption.


Content Creation:


	Create high-quality posts, graphics, carousels and short videos tailored to each platform.
	Humanise the brand through team stories, community highlights and customer insights.
	Repurpose blog posts, case studies, events and reports into social-friendly formats.
	Work with Brand &amp; Product Marketing to ensure messaging consistency.


Growth and Campaign Execution:


	Launch social-led campaigns that support demand generation, events and product promotions.
	Collaborate with Performance Marketing on paid social campaigns and retargeting.
	Test new content formats and creative approaches to improve reach and engagement.


Monitoring and Reporting:


	Track KPIs including reach, engagement, clicks, traffic and conversions.
	Monitor sentiment and identify emerging trends or risks.
	Provide regular performance insights and recommendations to the Marketing Lead.


Compliance and Risk Awareness:


	Ensure social content follows internal compliance and communication guidelines.
	Maintain accuracy when referencing products, features and merchant information.


Requirements
What You Will Need:


	1&ndash;3 years of experience in social media management or digital content creation.
	Strong writing and visual communication skills.
	Ability to simplify complex fintech topics into engaging content.
	Experience creating videos, graphics and platform-specific content.
	Understanding of social analytics and reporting.
	Familiarity with demand-generation content and social trends.
	Ability to manage multiple deadlines and content calendars.
	Collaborative mindset and curiosity about fintech and payments.


What Success Looks Like:


	Consistent, high-quality content across all social platforms.
	Increased product understanding among merchants.
	Strong engagement and audience growth.
	Improved inbound pipeline driven by social campaigns.
	Strong alignment with the broader marketing strategy.


Benefits


	Health insurance
	Sponsored and tailored training
	Paid parental leave
	Paid time-off
	Flexible work style
	Annual performance bonus
	Low-interest loans
	Group Life Insurance
	Access to up to four therapy sessions monthly
	Day off on your birthday
	Employee interest groups that provide supportive communities within Kora
	Great company culture and the opportunity to work with a highly collaborative team building something great!


Note


	Kora is an equal-opportunity employer dedicated to building an inclusive and diverse workforce. All employment decisions are based on qualifications, experience, and business needs.
	We strongly encourage applications from underrepresented communities and diverse ethnic groups to apply.
	Please feel free to inform us if you need any accommodations to facilitate your participation in the recruitment process.
	Any details you share will be used solely to ensure we can support and accommodate your needs appropriately.
	We recognise imposter syndrome is real - any candidate who does not perfectly fit every characteristic of this role is still strongly encouraged to apply.

	Your work increases visibility, product understanding and inbound demand.


Key Responsibilities
Social Strategy and Execution:


	Manage social media channels end to end including strategy, planning, content creation and publishing.
	Develop platform-specific plans for LinkedIn, X, Instagram and YouTube.
	Maintain a consistent posting rhythm across all platforms.
	Ensure all content aligns with Kora’s brand identity and messaging.


Product Education and Adoption:


	Turn product updates and feature information received from the Communications Associate into clear social content.
	Create simple explanations for API capabilities, payment flows and new features.
	Produce educational content that drives interest, trust and product adoption.


Content Creation:


	Create high-quality posts, graphics, carousels and short videos tailored to each platform.
	Humanise the brand through team stories, community highlights and customer insights.
	Repurpose blog posts, case studies, events and reports into social-friendly formats.
	Work with Brand & Product Marketing to ensure messaging consistency.


Growth and Campaign Execution:


	Launch social-led campaigns that support demand generation, events and product promotions.
	Collaborate with Performance Marketing on paid social campaigns and retargeting.
	Test new content formats and creative approaches to improve reach and engagement.


Monitoring and Reporting:


	Track KPIs including reach, engagement, clicks, traffic and conversions.
	Monitor sentiment and identify emerging trends or risks.
	Provide regular performance insights and recommendations to the Marketing Lead.


Compliance and Risk Awareness:


	Ensure social content follows internal compliance and communication guidelines.
	Maintain accuracy when referencing products, features and merchant information.


Requirements
What You Will Need:


	1–3 years of experience in social media management or digital content creation.
	Strong writing and visual communication skills.
	Ability to simplify complex fintech topics into engaging content.
	Experience creating videos, graphics and platform-specific content.
	Understanding of social analytics and reporting.
	Familiarity with demand-generation content and social trends.
	Ability to manage multiple deadlines and content calendars.
	Collaborative mindset and curiosity about fintech and payments.


What Success Looks Like:


	Consistent, high-quality content across all social platforms.
	Increased product understanding among merchants.
	Strong engagement and audience growth.
	Improved inbound pipeline driven by social campaigns.
	Strong alignment with the broader marketing strategy.
